dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: An unguarded railway crossing in the Zhambyl region—that sounds like a disaster waiting to happen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An unguarded railway crossing in the Zhambyl region-that sounds like a disaster waiting to happen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it almost was! A bus just drove right onto the tracks on June 7th, and a passenger train had to make an emergency stop to avoid hitting it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it almost was! A bus just drove right onto the tracks on June seventh, and a passenger train had to make an emergency stop to avoid hitting it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A passenger train narrowly avoided a collision with a bus that drove onto the tracks in the Zhambyl region, according to Kazakhstan Temir Zholy (KTZ). The incident occurred on June 7 at an unguarded, regulated railway crossing between Koragatty and Tatti on the Taraz-Shu section.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, the bus driver actually fled the scene? That's unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, the bus driver actually fled the scene? That's unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bus driver fled the scene.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, they took off. But honestly, thank goodness for that train crew's quick thinking—KTZ said their professionalism totally prevented a tragedy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, they took off. But honestly, thank goodness for that train crew's quick thinking-K T Z said their professionalism totally prevented a tragedy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thanks to the alertness and professionalism of the locomotive crew, a potential tragedy was averted, KTZ said in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And this wasn't even the only incident? They mentioned something happening the day before too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this wasn't even the only incident? They mentioned something happening the day before too?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A similar incident had taken place the day before.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, on that same Taraz-Shu line! Some cargo trailers detached from a tractor and ended up on the tracks. The train stopped just two meters away this time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, on that same Taraz-Shu line! Some cargo trailers detached from a tractor and ended up on the tracks. The train stopped just two meters away this time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On the same Taraz-Shu line, trailers loaded with cargo detached from a tractor and ended up on the railway tracks. The train driver again applied emergency braking, managing to stop the train just two meters from the trailers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Two meters? That's way too close. It's like these near-misses are becoming a pattern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two meters? That's way too close. It's like these near-misses are becoming a pattern.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. KTZ is really pushing the message about safety at crossings now—railways are high-risk zones, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. K T Z is really pushing the message about safety at crossings now-railways are high-risk zones, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: KTZ reminded the public about the importance of following safety rules at railway crossings, emphasizing that railroads are high-risk areas and violations can lead to serious consequences.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, you'd think people would get that by now. But then they also shared that sweet story about the baby born on the Astana-Zhezkazgan train back in May.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, you'd think people would get that by now. But then they also shared that sweet story about the baby born on the Astana-Zhezkazgan train back in May.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: JSC "Passenger Transportation" had previously reported, on May 27, that a baby girl had been born aboard the Astana-Zhezkazgan passenger train.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh right, a little bright spot in all this. But still, these close calls are pretty alarming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh right, a little bright spot in all this. But still, these close calls are pretty alarming.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It really makes you appreciate how much depends on those drivers being alert every single second.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It really makes you appreciate how much depends on those drivers being alert every single second.
